steps.title: Landing on the Dashboard
details: Users successfully reach http://localhost:5173 across all tests.

steps.title: Creating a New Task
details: Most tests proceed through the “Add Task” modal, populate fields, and attempt to submit.
Hard failure: in the Drag & Move Task flow, the Categories dropdown stays open and intercepts the pointer, so the “Create Task” button never registers (Step 8 → fail).

steps.title: Editing, Completing and Re-ordering Tasks
details: Dragging to reorder never begins (blocked by earlier failure).
Mark-as-done flow works but visual strike-through / feedback is inconsistent and sometimes unobserved.
Edit flow technically passes, but UI shows mis-aligned labels and no clear Save confirmation.

steps.title: Category Management
details: Editing & favouriting categories succeed, but ‘Add New Category’ with colour Violet fails – new category never appears (Steps 7–8 → fail).

steps.title: Settings / Appearance
details: Dark-mode toggles work, but some options (e.g., Reduce Motion ‘System’) remain pending.
Glow effect toggle lacked disable step observation.

steps.title: Advanced Share / Export
details: Share via link passes but toast confirmation often missing.
Share via QR – QR rendered but download flow left pending; final screenshot not captured.
Export to Calendar – ‘Add to Apple Calendar’ button clicks but .ics never downloads (Step 8 → fail).

steps.title: PWA Installation
details: User cannot find an ‘Install App’ prompt; all install-and-launch steps fail.

steps.title: Logout
details: Logout option works, though confirmation copy is absent.

emotional_arc: Starts confident on landing page. Slight friction appears during task creation (extra clicks, modal clutter). Frustration spikes when Create Task is blocked by an open dropdown, or when actions (Add Category, Export, Install PWA) silently fail. Confidence partially returns on simple flows (logout) but overall ends with doubt because several advanced features feel unreliable or unfinished.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Hidden overlays (e.g., open dropdowns, popovers) intercept clicks, causing hard-stops that feel like broken buttons.
next_actions: Automatically close dropdown menus on outside click or when modal primary action is attempted.
Add z-index & pointer-events tests in CI to catch future regressions.
Provide inline error or shake animation when primary action is blocked.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Nearly every UI review flags mismatched fonts, margins, and button styles; this erodes perceived quality and brand trust.
next_actions: Adopt a global design-token system (spacing, font sizes, button variants).
Audit all MUI component overrides; ensure one source of truth.
Run an automated visual regression tool (e.g., Chromatic) on every PR.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users often do not know if an action succeeded (task added, category favourited, link copied). Absence of toasts or in-place updates creates uncertainty.
next_actions: Add toast/snackbar for all CRUD actions (created, updated, deleted, shared).
Ensure visual states (strike-through, star fill) update immediately after action resolves.
Include success/error aria-live regions for accessibility.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Advanced features are broken; users investing time to integrate with calendars or share tasks hit dead-ends → churn risk.
next_actions: Debug calendar export endpoint; ensure proper ‘Content-Disposition: attachment’ header.
Make “Download QR” a direct link with correct Blob/Object-URL fallback.
Add PWA manifest + service-worker ‘beforeinstallprompt’ handler; surface install button in header toolbar.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Low contrast colors and small fonts exclude users and fail WCAG; also mentioned repeatedly by UI reviews.
next_actions: Run automated a11y audit (axe) and fix < AA issues.
Provide theme color ramp with guaranteed contrast ratios.
Enforce min font-size via style-lint rules.

first_tackles.description: Fix pointer-intercept bug that blocks “Create Task” when a dropdown/menu is open.
Add universal toast/snackbar for create / update / delete / share actions to give immediate feedback.
Standardise typography, spacing and button variants using a shared design-token file.
Ensure calendar export endpoint returns a valid .ics download; smoke-test via automated test.
Surface a clear, always-visible PWA install button and register ‘beforeinstallprompt’ to improve discoverability.
